titleStmt.title: Trisagion or, The three holy offices of Iesus Christ, the sonne of God, priestly, propheticall, and regall how they ought of all his Church to be receiued. VVith a declaration of the violence and iniuries offered vnto the same, by the spirituall and Romish Babylon ... Reuealing many blasphemous mysteries vnknowne to the vulgar. By Richard Fovvns, Doctor of Diuinitie, and chaplaine domesticall to the late illustrious Prince Henry.
titleStmt.author: Fowns, Richard, 1560?-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Humfrey Lovvnes for Mathevv Lovvnes: and are to bee sold at his shop in Pauls Church yard, at the signe of the Bishops head,

notesStmt.note: "The second booke· The propheticall office of Iesus Christ" and "The third booke· Of the kingly office of our Lord and Sauiour Iesus Christ" each have separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
With a bifolium [sec.]² , "A more perfect note of the popish authors", bound before C1. Variant: lacking this quire.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Pauls Church yard, at the signe of the Bishops head
